summary: USDA’s Agricultural Marketing Service (AMS) oversees the work done by 22 commodity research and promotion programs, such as for dairy or pork. These programs are funded by commodity producers, and they are explicitly prohibited from engaging in certain activities—such as promoting false advertising. We reviewed the 104 Freedom of Information Act requests submitted to AMS for those programs during fiscal years 2012 through 2016. We...
title: Agricultural Promotion Programs: Status of Freedom of Information Act Requests
